questions.text: The very first place you find in this game is also where the queen lives.  What is this place called?
questions.explanation:
Bartonia.

	Bartonia is where you live when you begin before you begin any quests.  Silvermyr, Dunkhor, and Gluk are places you later find, and can later seige.

questions.text: What type of creature is Grong?
questions.explanation:
Ogre.

	Grong is obsessed with eating.  He will eat anything.  He has you get many different things for him to eat, including an ice troll, rock, and even an ogre.  Grong is as fat as can be and once he is in your party, he will take a bite out of any animal in the beginning of battle so 10 points damage is automatically done to that animal.

questions.text: What do you need to build in order to learn new spells from creatures you have captured?
questions.explanation:
Mage Tower.

	The Mage Tower can be built in your citadel, but only while you are in Bartonia.  The Tavern is where you get rumors.  Statues are the most expensive thing to build in your citadel, but once bought, you have a complete Citadel.

A dwarf.

	Khalkus, along with all other dwarves, have a Scottish accent.  Khalkus is another member you can have in your party, and he helps you fight cities and machines.  He also invented a machine that tracks cogs and gears from the "Great Machine" that he desperately wants to find.

questions.text: If you ride a wolf, what spell will he give you?
questions.explanation:
Howl.

	The rat is what gives you the rabid bite, and you can learn the hide spell without capturing a mount.  The wolf is a fast mount, so will get you places far distances quickly.  You can train mounts to higher levels, making you and the animal more powerful.

questions.text: Skeletons are able to wake the dead.  What does this mean?
questions.correct: They make some of the regular skulls +5 skulls
options: They turn all red mana to skulls
They do 2 points damage and 1 point damage for every skull in play
questions.explanation:
They make some of the regular skulls +5 skulls.

	They have the ability to turn several skulls into +5 skulls, which can be deadly.  When a +5 skull is used, it will also destroy any mana surrounding it, giving you full affect of each gem destroyed.  This can come in handy, unless it is your opponent who uses it.

questions.text: How old is Flicker, the gold dragon?
questions.explanation:
20 years old.

	This young dragon is the only dragon left after minotaurs come in and take dragons captive.  In your homeland, orcs come in and do the same thing.  You must find out where they are taking them.

questions.text: What kind of animal is the Mechotaur?
questions.explanation:
Minotaur.

	The Mechotaur is a mechanical minotaur with stronger powers than the regular minotaur.  You fight a minotaur for the first time in the Slavers camp.  It is a bonus quest, so you don't have to play it.  However, playing ALL quests will aid you greatly throughout the whole journey.

questions.text: Who is the very first to join your party?
questions.explanation:
Syrus Darkhunter.

	Syrus Darkhunter is an excellent fighter.  He does ten points of damage to any undead creature you fight by filling it with arrows.  He is a mysterious character that is not too open about his past.  He has you run several errands, but does not tell you why he wants you to do so.

questions.text: Where does Grong say he sees a tasty granite statue he would like to try?
questions.explanation:
The Valley of Things.

	Although it is really called The Valley of Kings, Grong thinks it is The Valley of Things.  This is a smaller city.  Every small city like this one holds a rune.  You can fight a runekeeper, and if you win, you will receive a rune.  These runes will help you build items in the future if you have built a place to forge items in your citadel.
